group_1.narration: ―Mikura―@So there was one here, of all places...

group_1.textCenter: (It's not a particularly old hokora, either.@I'd place it at about 50 years old, tops.)
(Though it could date back further, if that was@just when they happened to rebuild it.)
(How did it come to be...?)
(My legs are already killing me...)
(But let's take a trip to the library while@we're at it.)
(I knew searching the local history documents@first was a good idea.)
(...I see. Seems like it's one of those hokora@dedicated to Ryujin-sama?)
(Dates back to the pre-war period...)
(Maybe even before the Edo period, judging by@the content of this folklore?)
(It took a while to find this journal on it--@looks like it was self-published, too--)
(But there's so many details about the folklore@in here.)
(I've really got to thank the historian who@wrote this...)
Huh?
(There's a different tale described in the@footnotes of this magazine...)
(A virtuous monk built it as thanks for lending@him a place to stay for the night...?)
(...This is completely different from the@Ryujin-sama story. Guess the jury's still out.)
(Citations for this account...)
(Nice, here they are.@[chara:303801:lipSynch_0][wait:1.0][chara:303801:cheek_0][chara:303801:face_mtn_ex_050.exp.json]...Wow, there's a lot.)
(And all the sources from this point on are@ancient manuscripts, to boot.)
In which case...
None of them would be kept in this library, so@I guess I've just got to regroup tomorrow.
(Lastly...@What else could I still look up here?)
(Old maps of the area around the hill, maybe?)
(It might've been farmland back then, or@undeveloped entirely...)
(This book looks pretty easy to understand.@It's got photos from recent aerial surveys, too.)
Huh?!
